titleStmt.title: The Lord's-day to be kept holy Asserted in a familiar conference betwixt two friends about the unlawfulness of exercising their trades or ordinary callings on that day. Published for the use of ignorant people, to prevent the prophanation of that holy day. Licens'd, July 19. 1694. Edward Cooke·

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for William Marshal at the Bible in Newgate-street,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
